_description: Four medical recipes for dropsy — in couplets

HunHM64.First Lines:
The dropessy is well mervelusAnd to yonge and to ollde full
                    perelus…
HunHM64.Last Lines:
…And giffe hit hym to dryngke evyn & moroweHit schall
                    asuage the sike manys sorowe
HunHM64.Note:
Written as prose, with red capital strokes for initials of each line;
                    the first heading, ‘Here begynnythe for the Dropesy’.
HunHM64.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 244-6
                        (excerpts).
